body: Hi, all I'm practicing different typologies on ladybug and honeybee. But this twist type looks strange on the blue areas.(I set in legend that blue is 0 kwh/m²) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/8X4-ypFUpwnSJKS0xP*lZe0sHIglh2A9swDVAAecLR*Ovrovg*63vmNRqvAfGHk6g7e9AXoUmdPx22UnYt-k7r6tXbg9Nk95/V9XSBBE_OHLBNNTD34O4.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/8X4-ypFUpwl6PB-SQetzOn4gzHCfQhmN8HpVzqWeMlmpQlobgI8vQybNIYLOXgupT4XR0WO2xsaEPY3aAKoCf*zx0vD2PzoW/PA2HOOX_TN0KIQKUV.png) So what happened? Does anyone know ? I upload the gh files if necessary Thanks Best regards. Chryl

replies.body: It's because test points fall behind the meshed surface. to avoid this you can slightly add to _disFromBase value for cases with major twist.

[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/NIIlY*zRfQ-5dP-jrQNuOzKu*FG1IVyTLweN3wtmazadb*93*jmseoZ0idxwARXwOwNCIQc-xOyCztOecaGoNxGmUEHzRpr5/Q5NYX308PUCCEAIX8_T0J.png)Hi Mostapha, that works! Thank u very much ! :)

Hi, 

I have quite similar problem, LB analyse only some surfaces, for radiation, sunlight hours, etc. The external get 0 value.
[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/C31AgRiB4u4C4cRslFPw1K2ngNuWWWAaVEgUQcXNRUqXJtzpA38lhogIy214ru0MTFGWH6KlIfFSXlGg5*I7i678wSTE8sdK/Test01.png)I got rid of the GH definition to eliminate possible GH problems, but it still gives my strange solution.

Anyone? Thanks!
your problem is different. Check the normal surface for the outside rectangle. Make sure they are facing outwards.
